Sentence: Cynical and lacking in ambition, Jack has walked away from many of his (Jack) past interests--he (Jack) left his (Jack) dissertation in American History unfinished, and never managed to marry his (Jack) first love, Anne Stanton, the daughter of a former governor of the state
He (Jack) discovers that Judge Irwin accepted a bribe, and that Governor Stanton covered it up; the resulting blackmail attempt leads to Judge Irwin's suicide
Jack marries Anne Stanton and begins working on a book about Cass Mastern, the man whose papers he (Jack) had once tried to use as the source for his (Jack) failed dissertation in American History
